sources.data_found: Turing specifications: 1 'ultra-performance' node (DGX A100); 8 'performance' nodes with 2x NVIDIA Tesla V100 (32GB) each; 4 'teaching' nodes with 4x NVIDIA RTX 2080Ti each.

student_data.notes: Data retrieved from WPI Institutional Research Fact Book (Fall 2023 enrollment). Undergraduate CS count (1,365) refers to BS Computer Science majors. Grad CS count (254) is the sum of MS Computer Science (186) and PhD Computer Science (68). Does not include Data Science or Robotics Engineering majors.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Teaching partition: 4 nodes x 4 GPUs each.

gpu_resources.notes: Resource counts derived from Turing cluster specifications. 1) DGX A100 Node: 1 node x 8 A100 (80GB) = 8 GPUs. 2) Performance/GPU Nodes: 8 nodes x 2 V100 (32GB) = 16 GPUs. 3) Teaching Nodes: 4 nodes x 4 RTX 2080 Ti = 16 GPUs. Note: WPI also has access to the regional MGHPCC facility, but these listed resources are the specific WPI-owned/managed Turing cluster hardware.

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI, Claude, and Gemini models. Data primarily sourced from Gemini findings regarding the Turing Research Cluster and Institutional Research Fact Books, as OpenAI lacked browsing capabilities for this specific query.
